Pakar Pembangunan Jalan Seluruh RI Kumpul di Ancol, Bahas Apa?
05 Nov 2019, 03:18 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Foto: Eduardo Simorangkir

Jakarta - Himpunan Pengembangan Jalan Indonesia (HPJI) menyelenggarakan Konferensi Nasional Teknik Jalan ke-10 di Hotel Mercure Ancol, Jakarta, Selasa (5/7/2019). Acara ini dihadiri oleh sekitar 1.000 orang profesional yang terdiri atas para ahli dan praktisi jalan, lalu lintas dan transportasi, baik dari instansi pemerintah maupun swasta, perguruan tinggi dan mitra kerja lainnya.Wakil Menteri Pekerjaan Umum dan Perumahan Rakyat (PUPR) John Wempy Wetipo hadir langsung membuka acara yang digelar selama empat hari ini. Hadir pula Dirjen Bina Marga Sugiyartanto serta sejumlah perwakilan dari BUMN dan swasta.KNTJ ke-10 ini mengambil tema 'Pembangunan Infrastruktur Jalan dalam Era Teknologi Industri 4.0'. Para profesional yang hadir diharapkan bisa memberikan kontribusi dan peran aktifnya sebagai penyaji makalah maupun peserta konferensi.Wakil Menteri PUPR John Wempy Wetipo dalam sambutannya yang membacakan pidato dari Menteri PUPR Basuki Hadimuljono menyampaikan pentingnya pembangunan infrastruktur jalan dalam mencapai visi Indonesia Maju 2045. "Percepatan pembangunan infrastruktur dalam prioritas kebijakan pembangunan nasional, khususnya pembangunan jalan yang mendukung kegiatan ekonomi, merupakan langkah nyata bagi peningkatan dukungan konektivitas bagi peningkatan pelayanan sistem logistik nasional dan penguatan daya saing global," katanya.Infrastruktur sendiri masih jadi hal prioritas yang akan digenjot dalam pembangunan Indonesia lima tahun ke depan. HPJI diharapkan mampu memberikan kontribusi yang maksimal khususnya dalam pembangunan jalan."Presiden menekankan pentingnya pembangunan infrastruktur yang menghubungkan kawasan produksi dengan kawasan distribusi, yang mempermudah akses ke kawasan wisata, yang mendongkrak lapangan kerja, dan mengakselerasi nilai tambah bagi perekonomian rakyat," ungkapnya. Indonesian Road Development Experts Gather in Ancol, Discuss What?
05 Nov 2019, 03:18 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Photo: Eduardo Simorangkir

Jakarta - The Indonesian Road Development Association (HPJI) is holding its 10th National Road Engineering Conference at the Mercure Ancol Hotel, Jakarta, Tuesday (7/7/2019). The event was attended by around 1,000 professionals consisting of experts and practitioners of road, traffic and transportation, both from government and private agencies, universities and other working partners. Deputy Minister of Public Works and Public Housing (PUPR) John Wempy Wetipo attended immediately opened the event which was held for four days. Also present was the Director General of Highways Sugiyartanto and a number of representatives from SOEs and the private sector. The 10th KNTJ took the theme 'Road Infrastructure Development in the Industrial Technology Era 4.0'. The professionals present are expected to contribute and have an active role as presenter of papers and conference participants. Deputy Minister of PUPR John Wempy Wetipo in his speech read a speech from Minister of PUPR Basuki Hadimuljono conveying the importance of road infrastructure development in achieving the vision of Indonesia Forward 2045. "Accelerating infrastructure development in the priority of national development policies, specifically road construction that supports economic activities, is a concrete step for increasing connectivity support for improving national logistics system services and strengthening global competitiveness, "he said. The infrastructure itself is still a priority that will be boosted in Indonesia's five-year development forward. HPJI is expected to be able to make a maximum contribution, especially in road construction. "The President stressed the importance of infrastructure development that connects production areas with distribution areas, which facilitates access to tourist areas, which boosts employment, and accelerates added value for the people's economy," he said.
